subject: RE: [junit] a test framework to codify levelizaton?
msgSnippet: ... My current workspace contains around 80 projects , summing up to estimated 0.5 M LOC. The main problem is that the plugin just queues up test runs,
messageBody:
mrutherfurd@... wrote:

> What do you consider to be "big"?

My current workspace contains around 80 "projects", summing up to
estimated 0.5 M LOC.

The main problem is that the plugin just queues up test runs, without
checking for duplicates. So if a build gets triggered every few seconds
and your tests typically need a little bit longer to run, the queue
builds up.

> I would love something to automate
> the running of the test cases as my co-workers are a bit unreliable
> when it comes to that (JUnit has had a slow takeup here :-(.

Install a Continuous Integration Server, such as Cruise Control or
AntHill. Or just Pair Program with them... ;)

Cheers, Ilja
